intro: Hieracium christii, commonly known as the Christ's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or reddish in color, with bracts that form a spiny involucrum. Hieracium christii is often found in open meadows and grasslands at higher elevations.
